docs.lead_paragraph: Stanley Brezenoff, his tired eyes the size of peas behind glasses slipping down his nose, was stopped yesterday by the palm of a security guard at the entrance to One World Trade Center. He was asked to produce his identification card. "This is my building," said Mr. Brezenoff, the executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. "But that's O.K. They asked me for I.D. at 1 Police Plaza, too, and then they also told me I looked a lot younger in my picture -- which was taken before the explosion."

headline.main: CRISIS AT THE TWIN TOWERS: The Director; Port Authority's Chief Takes Blast Personally
